content.question: Which of the following claims about a binary compound in which the bonding is ionic is most likely to be scientifically valid?

choices.label: Both elements in the compound are metals.
The atomic masses of the elements in the compound are relatively small.
There is equal sharing of electrons between the atoms of the elements in the compound.
The electronegativity difference between the elements in the compound is relatively large.

content.answer: The electronegativity difference between the elements in the compound is relatively large.
